ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: In ancient Roman mythology, 'Pluto' was the ruler of the underworld and presides over the afterlife. 'Pluto' was frequently conflated with 'Plutus', the god of wealth, because mineral wealth was found underground. When plotting with R, you try once, twice, practice again and again, and finally you get a pretty figure you want. It's a 'plot tour', a tour about repetition and reward. Hope 'plutor' helps you on the tour!

In ancient Roman mythology, 'Pluto' was the ruler of the underworld and presides over the afterlife. 'Pluto' was frequently conflated with 'Plutus', the god of wealth, because mineral wealth was found underground. When plotting with R, you try once, twice, practice again and again, and finally you get a pretty figure you want. It's a 'plot tour', a tour about repetition and reward. Hope 'plutor' helps you on the tour!

name: r-plutor
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.1.0' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-plutor
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/plutor_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/plutor/plutor_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: f686658f1cdb98cb37a9f816153f9df03da170c1701d26703054be980fd99c27

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/R.dll'        # [win]
    - '*/Rblas.dll'    # [win]
    - '*/Rlapack.dll'  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-rcolorbrewer
    - r-baizer
    - r-cli
    - r-dplyr
    - r-ggh4x
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-ggsci
    - r-magrittr
    - r-purrr
    - r-repr
    - r-rlang
    - r-scales
    - r-stringr
    - r-tibble
    - r-tidyr
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-rcolorbrewer
    - r-baizer
    - r-cli
    - r-dplyr
    - r-ggh4x
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-ggsci
    - r-magrittr
    - r-purrr
    - r-repr
    - r-rlang
    - r-scales
    - r-stringr
    - r-tibble
    - r-tidyr

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('plutor')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('plutor')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/william-swl/plutor
  license: MIT
  summary: In ancient Roman mythology, 'Pluto' was the ruler of the underworld and presides over
    the afterlife. 'Pluto' was frequently conflated with 'Plutus', the god of wealth,
    because mineral wealth was found underground. When plotting with R, you try once,
    twice, practice again and again, and finally you get a pretty figure you want. It's
    a 'plot tour', a tour about repetition and reward. Hope 'plutor' helps you on the
    tour!
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT'
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: plutor
# Title: Useful Functions for Visualization
# Version: 0.1.0
# Authors@R: person("William", "Song", , "william_swl@163.com", role = c("aut", "cre"))
# Description: In ancient Roman mythology, 'Pluto' was the ruler of the underworld and presides over the afterlife. 'Pluto' was frequently conflated with 'Plutus', the god of wealth, because mineral wealth was found underground. When plotting with R, you try once, twice, practice again and again, and finally you get a pretty figure you want. It's a 'plot tour', a tour about repetition and reward. Hope 'plutor' helps you on the tour!
# License: MIT + file LICENSE
# Encoding: UTF-8
# RoxygenNote: 7.2.3
# Imports: baizer, cli, dplyr, ggh4x, ggplot2, ggsci, grDevices, grid, magrittr, methods, purrr, RColorBrewer, repr, rlang, scales, stats, stringr, tibble, tidyr, utils
# Suggests: covr, svglite, testthat (>= 3.0.0), vdiffr
# Config/testthat/edition: 3
# Depends: R (>= 2.10)
# LazyData: true
# URL: https://github.com/william-swl/plutor
# BugReports: https://github.com/william-swl/plutor/issues
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2023-10-27 02:57:29 UTC; william
# Author: William Song [aut, cre]
# Maintainer: William Song <william_swl@163.com>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2023-10-27 08:00:02 UTC
